name: Taupo DeBretts Spa Resort

reviews.title: De Bretts Thermal Resort = Bad Service
reviews.text: Expect extremely poor and inexperienced service if you decide to stay here. You're better off staying elsewhere, as you'll get better value for money.

reviews.title: Girl's Weekend Away
reviews.text: My friend and I went to Taupo for a Girl's pampering weekend. I had seen the De Bretts Website and they had a Spa Indulgence Package that sounded good. It included accommodation in one of their 2 bedroom spa chalets, a facial or massage, mineral soak, breakfast at the Bistro Lago restaurant next door, bottle of wine and a small spa gift (soap and samples).

reviews.title: Come for the price, stay for the pools
reviews.text: The service was good and reception staff were very helpful during our two night stay. The chalet was well equipped with 2 bedrooms (king beds), kitchen, living area, separate toilet and bathroom. It was very clean and comfortable, apart from the tired sofa bed/couch in the living area that was in need of replacement.

reviews.title: Awesome Family Friendly Place to Stay
reviews.text: All of the added extras of the package were great. The spa staff were good (although my therapist could refine her practice a little... probably will develop with more experience) and the mineral soak very relaxing. We ate both dinner and breakfast at Bistro Lago and the food and service were fantastic.

reviews.title: Superb!
reviews.text: All in all, we had a nice time in Taupo and met our goal of a weekend pampering escape. I would recommend De Bretts to other groups, small families and couples looking for a relaxing time away.

reviews.title: Great holiday destination for extended family groups
reviews.text: My wife and I spent two nights at Taupo De Bretts in a cottage in early January. It was clean and modestly equipped. The camp sites appeared somewhat cramped. The kitchen had appliances but inadequate fridge space and unfortunately no dishes (not even a can opener). The bathroom facilities were among the more outdated and lines seemed to form to take showers. We really enjoyed the mineral spas (guests get a discounted admission fee) and the pools are great – but beware the waterslide, it is no joke. The amoebic Meningitis warnings also did not seem particularly well displayed and were never enforced by the guards. Overall, facilities were not among the better we’ve seen in NZ but would consider staying again for the water park and pools.

description: Choose to stay ahead of the game with our awesome Luxury Accommodation – self contained villas, lodges and spa chalets, providing an indulgent escape and complete with panoramic lake and mountain views. Or stay true with our ever-popular Qualmark rated 5 Star Holiday Park accommodation – from camping to van sites, cabins and motels, all spacious and excellent value.
